 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קֻבַּ֫עַת‎</span> **noun feminine** ==cup== (perhaps loan-word from Assyrian [<abbr title="transliteration"><u>***‡abu°tu***</u></abbr>], plural <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***‡abûâtê***</u></abbr>, probably ***cups, goblets***; compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***flower-cup, calyx***); — construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כּוֺס‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַתַּרְעֵלָה ק‎</span> [[Isa.51.17|Isa 51:17]] compare v[[Isa.51.22|Isa 51:22]] (both figurative, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כּוֺס‎</span> in both probably explanatory gloss, see Commentaries).
